confession.seduction_context: appeared to her in her field at Varcosey when she was very angry; offered gold and silver to make her rich, and promised that anyone she cursed would suffer harm

testimony.quarrel_subject: insults between accused and witness's wife; later insults to witness himself

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: First interrogation; partial confession of seduction by devil, sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Named accomplices; refused to confess to causing harms

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Procureur requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Threatened with torture; admitted attending sabbat 12+ times, making hail

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Placed on rack; confessed to all alleged harms with powder

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence, subject to reiteration without torture threat

timeline.subject: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions without torture threat

accomplices_named.context: seen at sabbat; fled long since

accomplices_named.context: seen at sabbat; persuaded group to harm belltower rather than crops

harms_catalog.harm_description: trouble with breasts; lost use of limbs for a year; had to be fed like a child
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: several quarrels between accused and witness's wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly fell ill; ill for 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over insults; witness obtained reparation
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after obtaining reparation, while putting bread in oven

harms_catalog.harm_description: pain in side as if struck with stick; ill for 5 years; body as if it had been skinned; lost milk and unable to suckle children
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel about hens getting into accused's garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: struck by lightning; various minor damage, blows to those inside, terrible smell of sulphur
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: masons had dispute with accused and moved out; carpenters lodged with Marlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: great quarrels with accused; fell ill and died within a year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: various quarrels; refused to be godmother; accused heard she suspected her

harms_catalog.victim_name: Claudatte (daughter of Barbon femme Bastien Marande)
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, losing use of limbs; died in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: daughter teased accused's daughter during carnival mascarades

harms_catalog.harm_description: had baby, fell ill soon after, died in 4 weeks
fell on pavé outside house, hurting arm; then fell in doorway and hurt side; abscess formed, going to knee
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to help accused take bread to villages

harms_catalog.harm_description: damaged by lightning strike on Marlier's house
fell from hayloft, injuring herself; ill for 3 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: masons came to live with witness after leaving accused's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: kicked in stomach by black horse being shod; died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: blamed him for their ruin; cost them 500 francs over sale of house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: devil killed him at accused's request

harms_catalog.harm_description: tested powder on her own animals

relationships.evidence_text: had been married to Guillaume Bouchier for 28 years
daughter of Melchior le Havenaire and his wife Libaire
as next neighbours at Vieu Marché
his wife Annon quarrelled with Libaire
tavern next door to house of accused

notable_quotes.speaker: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
notable_quotes.french: que son mary avoit desja eu une autre femme qui luy avoit guiere demeuré, et que peult estre elle n'y demeureroit encor guiere
notable_quotes.english: that her husband had already had another wife who had not stayed with him long, and that perhaps she would not stay long either
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Jennon femme Claudon Woiriat after quarrel over hens

notable_quotes.speaker: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
notable_quotes.french: que le grand diable puisse tomber, sur ladite maison, sur eulx et sur tous ceulx qui estoient
notable_quotes.english: that the great devil might fall upon that house, upon them and upon all those who were there
notable_quotes.context: Curse on carpenters lodging with Jean Marlier after masons left her house

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Marlier
notable_quotes.french: son intention estoit bien de faire apprehender ladite Libaire pour sorciere et luy faire faire son proces, Mais comme les moiens luy manquoient pour subvenir a telle chose il se depporta de son opinion par le conseil de ses amys soubz esperance de quelque fois il auroit quelque accusation contre elle
notable_quotes.english: his intention was indeed to have Libaire apprehended as a witch and have her tried, but as he lacked the means to pursue such a thing he abandoned his plan on the advice of his friends, hoping that someday there would be some accusation against her
notable_quotes.context: Witness explaining why he did not prosecute after lightning strike

notable_quotes.speaker: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
notable_quotes.french: et quand bien l'on mauldiroit une femme qui est femme de bien il ne luy sauroit mescheoire
notable_quotes.english: and even if one cursed a woman who is a good woman, no harm could come to her

notable_quotes.speaker: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle a offencé quelque personne par malediction qu'elle en crie mercy a Dieu et a Justice
notable_quotes.english: that if she has harmed any person by curse, she begs mercy from God and Justice

notable_quotes.speaker: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
notable_quotes.french: que ladite mairesse Masson et ladite Barbelline se fassent desrompre tant qu'elles vouldrons et obstant qu'elles ne voulussent rien confesser, sy est ce qu'elles sont sorcieres, aussy bien qu'elle l'est
notable_quotes.english: let the mayor's wife Masson and Barbelline be tortured as much as they want, and even if they refuse to confess anything, they are witches just as she is
notable_quotes.context: Accused naming accomplices and insisting they are witches despite being rich

material_culture.context: Jean Mareschal was baker; accused helped take bread to surrounding villages; bread obtained from accused's house used in healing counter-magic
obtained from accused's house and used in soup for healing counter-magic
obtained from accused's house and used in soup for healing counter-magic
plate of cabbage obtained from accused's house; eating it cured illness
Jean Mareschal spent over 100 écus trying to find healing for wife
devil told accused to grease broom to fly to sabbat
brought from Jerusalem by grandfather; wore in bag around neck for protection
wore in bag around neck for protection; placed under sheet on altar
wore in bag around neck for protection
given by devil: brown to kill, black to cause languishing, white to cure
Richard Didier Anthoine bought in Germany; kicked him while being shod
Jean Mareschal was putting bread in oven when he fell ill

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jean Mareschal's wife called accused 'meschante femme' and accused her of witchcraft; husband obtained reparation for insults but did not pursue reparation for being called witch
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: husband paid reparation for calling her 'meschante femme'

prior_legal_disputes.description: Richard Didier Anthoine cost accused and husband 500 francs over sale of house

hearsay_chains.content: heard Jean Marlier's wife blame accused for her illness
heard Jean Marlier's wife claim that Libaire had bewitched her

emotional_state_notes: initially insisted she was a good woman
begged for pity on poor children
asked to be executed on Wednesday rather than market day so fewer people would be present

third_parties.context: healed Jean Mareschal's wife, saying it was poison and witchcraft

third_parties.name: German doctor
third_parties.context: tending Colas Meclin; told Jennon she had been bewitched by her neighbor

third_parties.name: woman in Rossey, Germany
third_parties.context: healed Jennon's bewitchment; gave her mithridat which caused her to excrete foul matter including 'franges de sappin'

third_parties.context: masons were building for him; lodged with accused

third_parties.name: Annon (first wife of Claudon Woiriat)
third_parties.context: quarrelled with accused; had baby, fell ill, died in 4 weeks

third_parties.name: Anne fille Diey Bazelaire
third_parties.context: beaten accused's daughter; accused confessed to killing her with powder

third_parties.name: Richard Didier Anthoine
third_parties.context: cost accused 500 francs over house sale; kicked by horse and died

third_parties.name: Jean de Sarruix (mayor)
third_parties.context: relative of Marion femme Demenge le Masson; accused said rich relatives would cause her trouble

third_parties.name: grandfather of accused
third_parties.context: brought back waxen image of Virgin and stone from Jerusalem

economic_context.details: Richard Didier Anthoine cost accused and husband 500 francs over sale of house; accused said they were in great need at time of seduction; accused described as poor with poor children; rented all their houses rather than owning; helped take bread to surrounding villages (suggesting itinerant bread selling)

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with full witness testimony, multiple interrogations, torture, and detailed confessions. Clear timeline from preparatory investigation through execution. Rich detail on neighborhood quarrels, economic disputes, and counter-magical healing practices.
